inn1.comm: ooh, what a start...Strauss leaves this and it jags back sharply into his body and strikes him a painful blow in the stomach. Ouch.
that's a cracker, full on middle and drilled straight past mid-on...what a start from Pakistan
beaten this time...Strauss plays a flat-footed drive and the ball scoots past the inside edge
stays on the back foot and pushed into the covers
on the stumps, worked away into midwicket to open his account and England's
on middle and leg, squares up Davies a touch as he defends to mid-off
what a beauty to finish with, moves away late past the outside edge and carries nicely through to Kamran. A fine opening over from Shoaib
lovely shot, whipped away off middle and leg and it races away through square leg for the first boundary
better line on off stump and Strauss defends to the off side
comes across his crease and pushes firmly to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, punched straight to short cover
defended solidly down to mid-on again...Razzaq keeping a good line to Strauss on middle and off
very nicely done, punches this beautifully straight down the ground past the stumps and it races across a fast outfield
opens the face and drives square to backward point
back of a length and worked behind square on the leg side...long leg can't stop the second
great timing from Davies...flicked away off leg stump and it was to the boundary in a flash. He has looked in fine touch all series and used Shoaib's extra pace well
ooh, what a come back...a touch fuller on off stump and it beats Davies for pace
worked off middle stump down to mid-on
good line on middle and off, Davies defends into the off side
on the back foot and punched to the bowler in his follow through
wrong line on leg stump, worked away through square leg but there's a man deep on the boundary now so it's just a single
top shot...perfect from Davies as he leans into a cover drive and threads it through the off-side field. No stopping it.
real aggression this time as he charges down the pitch but then misses his attempted thrash through the covers
poor line, outside leg stump and flicked away past short fine-leg and deep square has no chance to get around...looks like there's plenty of runs on offer today
driven again, straight to mid-off but Afridi is deep and allows a sharp single
on off stump, Davies stands tall and defends to backward point
opens the face and defends square on the off side again
punched very firmly to mid-off and there's no chance of a run this time
worked away through square leg out to the man in the deep
nicely done from Strauss, worked away off leg stump and this time in front of square so it's a long chase around the boundary
defended into the covers
down the pitch and driven very firmly to cover
touch shorter and forced off the back into the covers
outside leg stump, Strauss uses his feet and works it out to deep square
gone! The move has worked for Pakistan, Davies advances down the pitch but is beaten by the spin and there's a simple stumping for Kamran Akmal - who actually makes it look simple
worked from off stump towards mid-on who is on his heels and allows Trott to get off the mark...Afridi won't be happy
on leg stump and tucked away to deep square
outside off and pushed away square to point
elegant from Strauss as he pushes off the back foot through cover...big boundaries square at The Rose Bowl
on the back foot, defended into the off side
well bowled, Strauss is beaten as he pushes away from the body...Shoaib has been excellent throughout this series
worked from off stump towards mid-on
beauty! Another one from Shoaib, moves away late to beat Strauss's edge...a terrific over
goes right across his stumps and works it from outside off to find deep square
width outside off but Strauss cuts it straight to the man at short point...he'll know he missed out there
massive from Strauss! Down the pitch and he clubs this over long-on with real power, that shows how his game has developed, and it comfortably clears the ropes
on off stump, pushed to mid-off and well taken single
defended down to mid-on
jabbed out to backward point
another beauty from Shoaib, moves away late across Strauss who was committed to the shot...superb stuff from Shoaib
worked out to deep square-leg
uses the extra pace and angles it down to third man
goes across the crease and places it wide of mid-on
gone! That's brilliant from Shoaib and it's late swing again, Trott drives without footwork and his stumps are demolished. Pakistan, and their supporters, go wild
gets an inside edge first ball as late swing troubles Bell, another superb over from Shoaib
outside leg stump, takes the pad
flicked away to midwicket
onto the back foot and pushes past the bowler but mid-off stops the run
huge appeal as Strauss misses a sweep but that pitch outside leg...pointless shout
down the pitch but Hafeez sees him coming, fires it in faster, and Strauss can only force into the off side
pushed down the off side, Hafeez fields in his follow through and that's an excellent maiden
hitting the seam and jagging away, Bell dabs down to third man

caught behind! Shoaib has been whistling them past the outside edge, and finally Strauss gets a touch to one. Big edge, and Kamran dives to his left to take it infront of first slip. Shoaib gets further reward for an impressive opening spell, and Pakistan are on top now!
slung down quick and on a length, but wide of off and easily left alone
full and searingly quick, shaping in through the air towards off stump, but Collingwood presses forward and defends with the full face back down the track
fuller still from Shoaib, and quick once again. This time Collingwood taps to mid-on
pushed full and wide, Collingwood won't be tempted though and shoulders arms
punched back hard towards the bowler, who gets a hand to it and tips it towards midwicket, who was running across to save the run
driven down to long-on, and an easy single taken
full outside off, Collingwood steps down the track and drills it back to the bowler
just a bit too short outside off, Collingwood slashes wide of Yousuf at point but he does well to scoot across and cut it off
driven towards mid-on, Hafeez does well to hurry across and cut it off
punchy drive to mid-off
fullish length just outside off, tapped defensively to extra cover by Bell
positive intent from Bell, who walks down the track but can't quite get a driveable length and defends once again
seaming away from the right-hander off a length, Bell hops back and plays it nice and late - right under the eyes - to point
Bell shapes for a controlled whipped-pull but is beaten by some seam movement back in to him - and a touch of pace - and is struck near the belly button
full on middle and leg, Bell steps across and flicks well but straight to midwicket
great start from Gul - a maiden - as Bell defends the last ball to backward point
quick offspinner to start, but just a bit too short and wide outside off, and he's cut late down to third man for a couple
there is a touch of turn for Ajmal - it's the offspinner, turning in from middle and clipped to square leg
chopped down to short third man for one
Ajmal's certainly not found his rhythm yet - this is much too short again and cracked hard out to deep cover
full on off, Collingwood steps forward and defends to off
good finish to a somewhat erratic first over, Collingwood stays deep in the crease and defends the topspinner late towards extra cover
back of a length, tapped down defensively to point
slightly wider of off this time, inviting the cut from Bell but he can't get any timing in the shot

crisply timed this time! Bell walked down the track to turn a full ball into a half-volley on the pads and clipped sweetly through straight midwicket. A fielder gave chase, but the ball won that race!
punched off the back foot out to deep cover
good, testing length from Gul, landing on middle stump. Collingwood plays from deep in the crease, nudging into the leg side
just short of that good length, and outside off. Collingwood defends to cover
Ajmal stays round the wicket, Bell presses forward in defence
watchfully tapped to midwicket by Bell, who appears to be picking Ajmal's variations
dabbed just wide of square leg this time, and they sprint through for one
tossed up on off stump as Ajmal stays round the wicket to the left-hander, solid defence from Morgan
fuller still on off stump, and Morgan inside-edges onto the front pad as he tries to punch into the off side
nicely driven, but straight to the cover fielder
Bell steps half-forward in defence to a length delivery, the ball seams a touch and squirts off the outer half of the bat towards point
seaming away again slightly outside off, left alone
tapped back down the wicket, Gul collects in his follow-through
elegantly driven down the ground! Nothing more than a firm push straight back down the wicket, but such is the timing that a sprinting mid-on can't catch the ball, another top shot from Bell
Gul adjusts his length, a touch shorter and Bell defends to extra cover
good length on off stump, and defended with a vertical bat by Bell
Morgan looks to play off the back foot, pushing the ball to cover
Morgan is off the mark with a tip-and-run single into the covers. He's so good at picking the tiniest of gaps and rotating the strike in these middle overs

doosra pushed full and wide across Bell, who pushes inside the line and is beaten. There's an appeal for a stumping as Kamran whips the bails off, but his back foot was grounded inside the crease the entire time
clipped to midwicket for one
slog-swept in the air ... but falling safely in the outfield and they rush back for the second
offspinner from Ajmal, and Morgan is beaten outside off by the turn. Plenty of excitement from Kamran, but he didn't get anything on it

an appeal from Afridi and Kamran! The ball definitely hit the outside edge, but appeared to go straight down and bounce before popping up into Kamran's gloves... They think it may have bounced up off the boot, and Doctrove goes to the third umpire. Nope, straight into the ground. How did Kamran not see that?
another appeal! This time for lbw as ball strikes pad, but there was a big inside edge and Doctrove rightfully says no
quick legspinner, defended back down the track
tight on off stump once again, and more defence from Bell
a little shimmy down the track from Bell this time, but can't quite get to the pitch
sure-footed drive from Bell, bisecting the fielders and rolling out to deep mid-off
with the sun setting, Ajmal is bowling in sunglasses now. And he looks cool. Another single to Bell as he drives to long-on
Ajmal is definitely finding some turn with the offspinner, as Morgan pushes forward and is beaten once again
width offered by Ajmal, but Morgan's forcing shot goes straight to a tumbling extra cover
forward defence from Morgan as the ball is pitched up on off stump
chipped over cover, calm as you like! Great execution of the chipped drive from Morgan, picking his spot to perfection and picking up four runs for his efforts
Morgan is forward and driving to mid-off
pushed up nice and full on middle, tapped down the ground
plenty of space on the leg side, and Morgan taps to midwicket for what should have been one ... but Shafiq runs right over the ball and the fumble means that it's two! Cheers from England's fans
driven to cover
slightly shorter and wider, again Morgan picks out the cover fielder
this one is placed into the gap, and Davies is called through for one
solid defence from Bell
and it continues to be all action as Morgan reverse sweeps to short fine-leg, where Umar Gul makes a brilliant save but then gives away an overthrow
flicked away into the on side
doosra from around the wicket, played with soft hands behind square on the off side and there's another fumble in the field
worked from off stump through midwicket, no one inside the circle and it's placed expertly by Morgan for a second
goes back into his crease this time and works it straight to deep midwicket
flicked from off stump down to long-on...it always looks odd when a batsman stands his ground as a run is taken
full and driven nicely through the covers but it's just a single
well bowled, a googly that beats the outside edge
pushed down the ground to long-off
tossed up outside off, Bell leans into a cover drive which finds the sweeper
on leg stump and flicked out to deep midwicket
gentle worked down the on side, evades Afridi's dive and dribbles to long-on
worked off the back foot down to long-on
chopped away into the covers but can't beat the in-field
beats the man this time out to the sweeper as Hafeez drops a touch short
neatly worked down to long-on again, just ticking the scoreboard over
ooh, this one doesn't turn and takes an inside edge into the leg side
flicked down the on side and Hafeez can skip across to field
dug out into the off side straight to cover
beaten outside off as he tries to guide it square
takes the pad into the leg side
comes out as a full toss but it only costs a single out to deep square
full on the stumps and worked to deep square by the right hander this time
steps back outside and cuts it hard out to the cover sweeper

nice shot from Morgan, waited for it outside off and chopped away through short third man...but Asad Shafiq makes a great save on the deep point boundary, or does he? Ah, shame, his foot was in contact with the rope at the second attempt
outside leg stump and pushed out to deep midwicket
worked down to long-on...Bell doing a good job despite his injury
quicker ball, Morgan on the back foot and can only force it back to the bowler
onto the front foot and defends to cover
lobbed in the air towards long-on, but it's an expert chip from Morgan who is able to collect a couple
opens the face and drives in the air over extra cover, but like Morgan places his chip very well between the fielders
defended square on the off side
tossed up on middle, almost finds the leading edge as Bell tries to turn it into the leg side
a strangled shout but this is going well down the leg side
beaten outside off as he goes to cut, that didn't quite bounce as Bell expected but was probably too full for the shot

gone! Afridi makes the breakthrough as he finds Bell's inside edge which then rattles the stumps. Was a flatter ball, Bell was trapped on the back foot...well bowled by Afridi, that's a key breakthrough
works this off leg stump out to deep square
almost drags this on as well as he goes for the cut and it bobbles to the keeper
pushed back to the bowler
defended into the off side...Hafeez has been a real problem to the England batsmen
bunted into midwicket where the fielder lets it through his legs
driven firmly out to the deep cover sweeper
driven down to long-off
on middle and pushed down to long-on
low full toss but he can't beat Afridi in his follow through
short outside off stump, Morgan rocks back and pulls it down to long-on
tossed up outside off, pushed gently into the covers
worked through square leg to keep the strike
onto the back foot and forced down the ground...straight of long-on which allows them back for a second
on off stump, leans forward and defends
uses his feet and works it wide of midwicket out to the deep sweeper behind him
quicker on leg stump, pushed back to the bowler who parries it but they don't get a run

well, it's all happening here...Morgan chipped it down then ground, Yousuf takes the catch but realises he's running over the boundary so flicks the ball back to save the boundary, then rolls his ankle as he goes over the rope.
much less eventful this ball as it's pushed along the ground to long-on
nicely driven through the covers and again good placements means it's a brace
almost a leading edge as he tries to work to leg
onto the back foot and whips it against the turn through midwicket with a straight bat
chopped away to short third-man
tries to ramp this past the keeper but just ends up a tangle as he misses the ball
short and worked off the back foot through midwicket for another couple
pushed down the off side, Hafeez moves across to field
steps to leg to give himself room but cuts straight to cover
outside leg stump, worked to deep square-leg
worked off the stumps down the ground
gives himself room again and cuts to the cover sweeper
onto the back foot and pushed down to long-on...the scoreboard ticking over, but at no great rate although England can't afford to lose more wickets
back of a length, worked off the body through square leg and placed wide of long leg
outside off and left alone
tucked off the stumps out to deep square
worked off leg stump to midwicket
opens the face and runs it down to third man
full on off stump, driven firmly to mid-off but it's a well-judged single
worked off the back foot down to long-on
short and pulled away hard but straight to deep midwicket
down the pitch and flicked very neatly over midwicket...the man in the deep does well to cut off the boundary
on leg stump, tucked around the corner wide of shirt fine-leg
lovely shot from Morgan, drives inside out through the covers and with placement to beat the deep fielders
takes the pad towards square leg
hint of width but cut straight to backward point
driven nicely through the covers, man inside the circle can only get half a hand on it
short and pulled away, doesn't come off the middle and just evades midwicket
wide outside off and cut out to deep cover...brings up England's 150
big shout, but must have been inside edge otherwise that was dead...replay looks like two pads so he's got a big escape there
worked off leg stump out to deep square
round the wicket, nurdly nurdle into the leg side and a quick single
Morgan taps to midwicket, Fawad Alam charges in from the boundary to keep them for one
flicked to short fine leg, where Umar Akmal tumbles over to cut it off
good batting, plenty of singles coming now. Nudged to long-on
pushed slightly wider of off, and slanting straight on with the arm. Collingwood aims a late cut but is beaten
pushed defensively into the covers
pushed firmly out to deep cover
valiant effort by Wahab down at third man as Morgan slashes a powerful cut, but he can't stop the ball crossing the rope and that's fifty for Morgan
landing on a length on middle and leg and seaming towards the slips, Morgan defends watchfully back to the bowler
bouncer from Gul, but this wicket doesn't have the pace in it for that sort of bowling and Morgan hooks him to long leg for four more!
tapped into the covers, straight to the fielder so no chance of a quick single. Nice crack off the bat as he played the shot
short and rising outside off, this has bounced slightly more than Morgan was expecting and his flashing cut is beaten on the top edge
fast topspinner on off stump, punched back hard
slightly misdirected towards leg stump, Collingwood shuffles across and picks up one behind square on the leg side
tip-and-run into the leg side from Morgan
speared in full and flat on off stump, dug out towards long-off and they scurry through
Ajmal's certainly not flighting them here, quick and flat again and Morgan punches to cover off the back foot
placed through cover point with the weight forward, and another single
pushed down the leg side, Kamran tumbles to his right and appeals for a catch but Doctrove calls wide. That's quite tight, and may have flicked his trouser leg
straighter this time, defence from Morgan
tight! They push hard for the second as Morgan glances to Wahab at fine leg. The shy was fired in and he would've been short if it had been a direct hit!
chopped defensively to backward point off the back foot
just short of a good length on off stump, Morgan aims a checked backfoot drive out to deep cover
width offered outside off, and Collingwood picks up another single to cover point
beaten outside off stump! A slightly lazy looking waft from Morgan, and the ball does enough off the pitch to beat him. Decent comeback over from Shoaib
rushing on after pitching, Collingwood plays from deep in the crease and is hit on the pad but that's going well down the leg side
whipped off the pad to midwicket
leading edge on a bottom-handed drive, and the ball is chipped down to long-off
full outside off, Collingwood steps forward and drives hard out to wide long-off
that looked like the offspinner from Afridi, but picked by Morgan and pushed into the covers for one
turn and bounce outside off, and Collingwood's defensive push is beaten. That was the legspinner from Afridi, held back a touch, and it gripped into the turf and spun
dabbed through point off the back foot, nice placement gets Morgan another single as he puts it right between the fielders in the circle
good length, just outside off, and Collingwood defends to mid-off
full and fast on middle and leg, Collingwood drives down to long-on
clipped off leg stump out into the deep, the fielder is across quickly so no chance of a second

good slower ball on off stump, Collingwood defends and Morgan starts to come down the wicket, looking for the single. But a surprisingly energetic Shoaib sprints across to pick up the ball and send Morgan scurrying back to his crease
yorker on middle! Decent pace too, but Collingwood dug it out nicely and the ball rolls down to long-on
arrowed down full on off stump, punched to long-off
and Morgan repeats Collingwood's shot - in reverse - for another single
tapped to backward point, they think about the single but there's none to be had
Collingwood shapes to glance to leg, inside edge onto the pad
again turn for Afridi as he flights a legspinner, but Collingwood is expecting it this time and chops the ball to point
Colly skips down the track this time, taking the ball on the full and whipping it out to deep midwicket
that has moved in towards the right-hander, but it's back of a length and has moved off the seam. Flapped to short fine leg
full on leg stump, and tapped into the leg side
fullish length on middle and off, but Collingwood stays deep in the crease and nurdles in trademark style to midwicket. Barely a hint of a backlift before the shot...
late cut, and the ball races down to third man
there is the yorker! That seemed to wobble in through the air, but it landed well wide of off and Collingwood dug it out to cover point
slower ball from Gul, picked by Morgan and pushed down to long-on
savagely pulled to square leg! That was much too short from Afridi, and Morgan almost sent the ball for six with a powerful shot. Bounced just short
too short again from Afridi, this time just one run though as Morgan bunts to long-on
Collingwood charges down the track and drives firmly to long-on
a rare sight - Morgan misses the reverse sweep and is struck on the pad. No appeal though, missing off
drilled down the ground, there's a slight fumble at long-off but not enough to give away the second
Collingwood steps right across to leg before the ball is even bowled and cracks hard to cover. There are no fielders out on the rope, but the ball is stopped on the edge of the circle
clatter! Yorker from Gul, ideal bowling for the situation and Collingwood falls. He had come down the track and given himself room, but swung right over the top of the ball and had his stumps broken

huge shout for lbw! It was full and tailing in again, Wright was hit flush on the front pad, but was that slipping down leg? Doctrove turns the appeal down, and yes that would've missed leg says HawkEye, good decision
full outside off, Morgan clears the front leg and aims a slash to off but is beaten on the outside edge. Third man is up, it looked as though he was trying to slap it past him
yorker on off stump, and all Morgan can do is dig it out back to the bowler
another very full ball, landing just outside leg this time and crashing into Morgan's pad. They scamper through for a leg bye
reverse-swinging yorker, dug out to cover and they take a frantic single! Afridi fires a throw at the stumps from mid-off but it's just wide!
Shoaib is nailing the yorkers too! Speared in right on middle and leg, and Wright does well just to keep that out

bowled him! That wasn't the yorker, it slipped out as a low, dipping full toss but it swung in sharply - and late - and beat Wright's flashing bat and smashed into the stumps. Wright had made room and was trying to thump it through the covers, but he was beaten by pace and late movement. Shoaib takes his third!
quick yorker on off, snaking in through the air and dug out to mid-off
good shot Eoin Morgan! Low full toss right on leg stump - and fast - but he just stepped to leg and cracked it straight back to pick up four down the ground
slower ball, on a length. Morgan dabs to gully for one
Shoaib lands one on a length on off stump, Bresnan defends
Morgan takes a step to leg and nudges a length delivery just to the right of Alam at backward point, quick single

slower ball, full and outside off. Bresnan was deceived by the lack of pace, and was almost through with the drive by the time the ball got to him, but he managed to get something on it - an inside edge - and pick up a single to short fine leg

shot! Morgan steps to the off side and plays a brave paddle over short fine leg. That was full, fast and aimed right at middle, he had to get something on it. Deep square does well to run round and save a run
punched to mid-off
another slower ball from Gul, Morgan spots it and taps to cover for one
and it's a good one! That has pinged right out of the middle, powerfully slapped through cover by Bresnan
muscled down to long-on by Morgan. He went aerial but fortunately didn't strike it too well - there's a fielder out there
crunched through cover! Shoiab was aiming for the yorker but missed his mark, and Bresnan was waiting to thrash the resultant half-volley through the ring of fielders on the off side
much better from Shoaib, this time he hits the yorker length, curving the ball in through the air as Bresnan digs it out
slower ball, chipped! But short of Asad Shafiq at cover point! They sprint through as Shafiq throws at the stumps, that would've been out if he had hit!

another desperate shy at the stumps, another miss, but this time there are going to overthrows! Umar Akmal it was, he actually did well to attack the ball and field it, but his throw was wide and the backing up wasn't great
yorker, speared in on middle stump and all Bresnan can do is dig it out
full and quite wide outside off, Bresnan throws the bat at it but can't get anything on it

Pakistan are being put under pressure in the field, and they're starting to crack. The ball was driven to Afridi in the covers, they stole a single and Afridi threw at the stumps. He missed and Alam fumbled
full and straight, a slower ball, nudged into the off side for one
cheeky shot, and Gul is not amused! Morgan went for a reverse sweep from a standing position - fine leg and third man are up - but missed and the ball just missed the off stump
full and straight, cracked down the ground where Wahab runs across and fields cleanly. Still back for the second though
slower ball, slapped through cover and beating a diving fielder there! But Ajmal charges across and cuts it off before the rope, three runs the result and Morgan keeps strike
Ajmal comes round the wicket and hurls this way down the leg side, Kamran can't do anything to stop that - wide!

great effort from Alam at long-on, but he can't stop the six! Bottom-handed thump down the ground by Morgan, Alam leapt but didn't time his jump very well, getting a hand to it - an achievement in itself - but tipping it over the rope
there's the hundred! Morgan, take a bow. He's giving England every chance of victory with a great innings, and he gets to the mark by crashing Ajmal straight down the ground
heaved out to deep midwicket, and they sprint back for the second
swiped across the line out to deep midwicket, the throw back in is not very good at all - Bresnan should have been run out at the non-striker's end - and it's two more
big swing, and this time he's missed completely! Dot ball
very full on the toes, cracked down to long-on

inn2.comm: poor start, on leg stump and eased away through midwicket...loosener from Bresnan and was easily put away
that's a cracker, full on middle and it's drilled straight down the ground past mid-on
better line from Bresnan, outside off and it's jabbed into the off side
defended into the off side
on off stump, pushed into the covers
on leg stump, wrong line, and flicked way out to deep square...poor over from Bresnan
back of a length on off stump, driven firmly square of the wicket
worked off the stumps, angling into Hafeez who works it behind square on the leg side
width offered from Anderson, cut hard into the off side but Eoin Morgan saves three runs for his team with a great dive at cover
wrong line again, pushed towards leg stump and it's worked comfortably through square leg
back of a length on off stump, punched firmly off the back foot to short cover
angling into the legs again and worked out to deep square...this has been a lazy start from England
lovely shot, flicked in the air over midwicket and it races away...Bresnan is angling everything into the batsman and it's easy pickings
that's better, outside off and Hafeez plays back to defends
back of a length outside off, stands tall and punches it back to the bowler
on off stump and defended firmly back down the pitch
short ball this time and Hafeez quickly latches on, pulling it high over square leg and it beats long leg across the boundary
outside off and left alone to end another indifferent over that cost two boundaries
on middle and off, pushed down to mid-off
full on off stump and driven, slightly uppishly, into the covers
outside off and defended firmly on the bounce to Swann at short point
dragged down short, Kamran pulls it away powerful and just past the umpire at square leg
back of a length on off stump, defended under his nose into the off side
keeps it on off stump, where it should be, and it's played solidly into the off side
starts outside off and it's well timed but straight at square cover
on off stump and Kamran defends into the on side
worked off the body to the man at short midwicket
full on off stump, he comes half forward and drives down to mid-off...good pace from Broad
angled into Kamran and it takes the thigh pad behind square on the leg side
forced off the back foot square on the off side and that's a good start from Broad
well bowled, Kamran is beaten as he pushes without footwork...but oddly, England don't have any slips in
lovely from Kamran, stands tall and drives handsomely through a packed off-side field...not much wrong with the ball
worked from off stump down to mid-on
comes forward and drives confidently into the covers...he's look a much different player in these one-dayers
driven in the air but he finds the gap between cover and mid-off...superb timing, he looks in fine form
driven square into the off side this time, well hit but straight at the fielder
onto the front and another strong drive, this time from Hafeez, but it finds cover
comes forward and opens the face to find backward point
short ball and Hafeez gets hit as he misses out on a pull
lovely, super batting...they'd just brought third man up so he opens the face and guides it straight through that area
on leg stump, worked away out to deep square and there's good running to back it two
poor ball, leg side and flicked away past short fine-leg...Pakistan are racing along
outside off and driven powerful straight to cover
width from Anderson and that's easy for Kamran as he throws his bat at it, sending it whistling through backward point
that's even better, full on off stump and driven through the covers...this is great stuff for Pakistan and the game is already running away from England
down the leg side, poor ball and it's called wide
back on off stump and defended square on the off side
defended into the covers
angled into leg stump and pushed firmly to short midwicket
full on the stumps and pushed firmly to mid-on
full and wide outside, driven square but one hand comes off the bat as he doesn't time it
back of a length outside off, defended firmly from the back foot to mid-off
worked into the leg side and fielded at short midwicket
dragged down short, that wastes Broad's good work as he gets hammered over midwicket with a thumping pull
full on leg stump, flicked away to deep square and that could easily have gone for four as well
on off stump, pushed towards mid-off and Hafeez sets off for a single but is sent back...probably the right call

huge appeal from Anderson for lbw...he implores Billy Doctrove but it's not-out call, maybe an edge? Nope, relays show it was two pads and that was plumb. Second one of those Doctrove has missed today
pushed firmly down to mid-on
comes forward and defends, Anderson collects in his follow through
defends on the walk again, bat and pad together into the off side
chopped into the off side, backward point is quickly in and that's a much-needed maiden from Anderson
short outside off, Kamran initially looked to duck out of the way but at the last moment saw that the ball wasn't rising as much as he thought and played down to gully
back of a length once more, this time Kamran hops and dabs to third man
that almost snuck through! Broad went full and straight and the ball wobbled in to the right-hander, who got just enough on it to keep the ball away from the stumps
pushed down the leg side by Broad
bouncer! Hafeez hurried to duck underneath it, and there's plenty of chatter from England
short again, this time Hafeez pulls out to deep square ... there's some confusion in the running as Hafeez wanted a second but Kamran sent him back
full of length on off stump, Kamran leans forward into a solid-looking defence
stifled appeal from Anderson! Again the ball hit Hafeez's front pad, but there was a little inside edge on that and in any case it was probably going down the leg side
full outside off, and sliced down to third man
driven hard, on the up, but straight to the cover fielder
width offered outside off, but slapped straight to backward point this time
that's definitely ducked in through the air, but he's right behind it in defence
just short of a good length, wobbling in a touch and tapped to mid-on
jagging in off the seam, the ball strikes the thigh and goes to backward point
on a length, pushed forcefully into the covers. Hafeez wanders out of his crease but there was never a single there

what is going on out there? There's no communication between the batsmen. Hafeez pushed to midwicket and immediately called, setting off, but Kamran was watching the ball and didn't move! Hafeez scampers back just in time...

vintage Collingwood, migraine or no migraine, great catch at backward point! It was short and rising outside off and Hafeez launched into a cut, but couldn't keep it down. Colly leapt to his right, plucking the ball out of the air, and England make the breakthrough! Hafeez is unhappy as he trudges off, he seems to be suggesting to Kamran that the ridiculous running broke his concentration

gone first ball! Caught behind! What a ball to get first up, Broad has been moving them in through the air but this one hit the seam - off a good length - and moved towards the slips. Shafiq hardly moved his feet, getting a thin edge, and Davies did the rest. Broad is on a hat-trick!
it was full, but outside off and Yousuf is off the mark straight away, pushing down the ground
nudged just wide of mid-on, and they push through for a quick one as the fielder fires in a shy. Yousuf doesn't seem to be struggling too much with that twisted ankle from earlier
on a length on off stump, pushed into the covers
short outside off, cut hard but straight to the man at cover point
driven on the up, straight to short extra cover this time
Bresnan just keeps hitting that length, and Kamran can't penetrate the off side
zoning in on off stump, defended to point
nasty, rising delivery from Broad! Spitting up off a length, and MoYo felt that on the fingers. He's struck right on the gloves
pushed slightly wider, this time Yousuf leaves well alone
back of a length once more, dabbed down to third man
punched firmly towards Strauss at extra cover, there may be a touch of dew forming  out there and the England captain couldn't quite hold onto the ball, a single comes off the fumble
pushed to mid-on off the back foot
beaten by a beauty outside off! Broad hits the seam and moves it away, Yousuf is caught on the crease and is lucky not to edge that
pulled out to deep midwicket, but not timed at all. Morgan charges in off the rope but tries to field one-handed, fumbles, and gives away a second
length on middle, pushed back to the bowler

dropped by Collingwood at backward point! It was wide of off and Kamran slashed hard, hitting the ball in the air. Collingwood made every effort to get to it, leaping to his right, but just parried it. A tough chance goes down. He held onto a similar one not long ago
appeal for lbw from Bresnan! But he's struck outside the line of off
forced out to deep cover off the back foot
that could've been run out! Yousuf was sent back after starting off for a single, and he really had to push hard. Anderson threw at the stumps, but the throw is just wide
tapped to the right of midwicket, quick single
tapped to backward point, no run. Some loud, slightly nervy calls of "no!"
driven uppishly through cover point - but in the gap
full outside off, Kamran goes for the booming drive and inside edges into the boot
driven hard through backward point, good timing on the shot and the fielder can't stop it. Third man runs round
Wright slips into the pads, and is nudged down to fine leg
beaten on the inside edge! Yousuf came forward to drive but the ball just nipped in and also kept a touch low, bouncing infront of Davies
back of a length, angled down to third man
forced through backward point
on a length, and punched to mid-off
nipping in off the seam, and driven to mid-off once more
clipped out to deep midwicket

Wright strikes! Kamran falls, lbw. Huge appeal, and he's given! Kamran really isn't happy, he doesn't want to go ... and HotSpot shows an inside edge, so that's very unlucky for him. But he's got to go
driven just wide of mid-off, and Alam is off the mark straight away with a quick single
curving in through the air and landing on a length, Yousuf steps back and defends under the eyes
similar ball, defended to cover
glanced elegantly and right out of the middle, but the ball goes straight to the man at deep square so just one run
loose drive outside off, and Alam is beaten on the outside edge! He does often look a touch vulnerable outside off at the start of his innings
Yousuf lunges forward to smother the spin, defending with bat and pad together
drift away from the right-hander, and turn back in to him. Yousuf is equal to it, though, and flicks through square leg
pushed through slightly flatter, and this one rushes straight on. Defended by Alam, although not entirely convincingly
slightly fuller, defended once more

what a ball! Swann strikes with his fifth ball of the match, and what a delivery it was. Tossed up, drifting towards the pad, dipping, gripping and spinning past Alam's uncertain push. Undone in the flight, beaten by the turn
played with the turn to square leg
on off stump, hint of movement into Yousuf who defends to midwicket
angled away down to third man off the back foot
full on the stumps, driven back down the pitch and Wright fields himself
outside off, Umar comes forward and defends to cover
opens the face to guide this down to third man to get off the mark
full and wide, Yousuf leans into a cover drive that finds the deep cover sweeper
on off stump, gently worked out to midwicket
outside off, opens the face to short third-man where Wright makes a good save
a neat sweep from Yousuf through short fine-leg
oooh, goes back to cut and almost gets an under edge into the stumps
big turn for Swann, Umar waits and defends by his feet
flicked off the stumps straight to square leg inside the circle
on the stumps and flicked straight to midwicket
back of a length and a touch of extra bounce defeats Yousuf as he tries to work into the leg side
outside off and easily opens the face to find third man
flicked off the stumps to midwicket...England keeping the pressure on
back of a length on off stump, defended with an open face to backward point
tries to run this down to third, but it's too close to him he finds backward point who is quickly onto the ball
tossed up on the stumps and worked away through midwicket
goes back and guides this very fine past the keeper...that was well played, but Wright makes an excellent diving save to cut off a run
goes down very early and laps this through short fine-leg
outside and turns quite sharply, Umar defends to the off side
a low full toss on leg stump is pushed gently down to long-on
onto the back foot and worked out to midwicket
hint of width but it only costs a single as Umar cuts out to deep cover
nice flowing cover drive from Yousuf, places it wide of the sweeper for a couple
another single to third man...he can play that in his sleep
well bowled, that moves late past the edge as Umar tries to run it down to third man again
full outside off, defended by his feet and for a moment he thinks of a single but Wright quickly follows through
played behind square on the off where Collingwood makes the save at backward point
nicely bowled as Yousuf's shot is defeated by turn from Swann
drifts onto leg stump and worked away through midwicket
onto the back foot and punched down to long-on which brings up Pakistan's 100
outside off, Yousuf comes forward and pushes to short third-man
almost defeated in the flight this time as he pushes hard, but it goes along the ground to cover
pushed off the back foot to cover...another tight over from Swann
driven firmly down to mid-off
short ball from Wright and it's pulled directly to deep square-leg
full on the stumps and pushed to mid-on
dropped into the off side, he wants a single but decides against it only for Anderson to run straight over the ball
nips back into Yousuf and it's defended hurriedly to cover
punched from off stump straight to mid-on...another good over
dropped in short, Umar latches onto a pull but it goes one bounce out to deep midwicket...came off the toe end
tucked around the corner to short fine-leg
comes forward and works this out to midwicket from outside off

what a beauty! Swann, what a bowler he is, spins this between Yousuf's bat and pad. Another stunner from the finest spinner in the world. Yousuf was looking to push into the off side, but was defeated all ends up
gone! And another! England on a roll as Afridi lunges forward but gets an inside edge into his stumps...Swann now on a hat-trick
huge appeal! But Doctrove says not out...probably did too much as Razzaq played half forward and was missing leg, but what an over from Swann. Brilliant stuff.
worked into the side
opens the face down to third man
on off stump and defended to backward point
back of a length and pushed into the covers...how will Razzaq play this?
goes fuller this time and Razzaq drives to same fielder - Anderson - in the covers
angled into leg stump, worked away through midwicket and there's no chance of a second
on off stump, pushed firmly into the off side...a no ball because England had too many on the leg side, that's unusual
waits for the turn then places this in the gap at cover
opens the face square on the off side
big appeal for lbw but Razzaq is well outside the line as he plays forward
flicked away through the leg side
takes the inside edge past short leg
steps back and cuts into the off side
dropped towards extra cover, there's a slight hesitation but they sprint through and though Anderson's throw hits the stumps Umar is home
length and aimed at the stumps, defended by Razzaq
forced to point off the back foot
beaten outside off! That was a beauty from Bresnan, hitting the pitch and seaming away, beating him all ends up
full outside off, squirted off the outer half of the bat down to third man
back of a length, cramping Umar for room and he hops back in defence
armball from Swann, tapped to point
much quicker from Swann, that's slipped out as a full toss outside leg with the effort, but it's clipped straight to short fine leg
pushed to cover point, and a quick single is the result
well, that's a brave shot! It was full but Umar stepped away and cut it off middle stump to short third man. Worth the risk?
going straight on with the arm, tip-and-run into the covers
Razzaq plays back and defends into the off side
cheeky! Full on middle, Umar bends into a premeditated paddle and lifts that over short fine leg. First boundary since the ninth over!
full outside off, pushed into the off side

Collingwood strikes with his third ball! Umar was looking to attack, driving hard back at the bowler but the ball just stopped on the surface and he pushed it in the air straight back to Colly. It was hit pretty hard - and Collingwood juggled the catch - but he held on and that's probably the last nail for Pakistan
very full on off stump, defended to cover
Gul is forward and defending once more. He leaves a huge gap between bat and pad, if that had cut in he'd be in trouble
Collingwood sprays this towards leg stump, and Gul is off the mark with a boundary. Just got a touch on it, sending the ball very fine down to the rope
Swann stays round the wicket, Razzaq forces out to deep cover off the back foot
flighted outside off, a touch of turn and Gul defends with it into the leg side
Gul lunges forward in defence this time, smothering the spin
same again from Pakistan's No. 9
flatter and full on off stump, squirted out to point for one
pushed across Razzaq, and angled to backward point
full and pushed to mid-on, Razzaq is eager for a single but Gul sends him back
direct hit and he would've been out! Gul tapped the ball to the left of Trott at mid-on and set off, he threw off balance and the throw went wide
short on off stump, Razzaq rides the bounce to send the ball down to third man
short again from Broad, this time it's better directed and Gul hooks but the ball takes the bottom edge and falls at his feet
back of a length, outside off and pushed into the covers
Broad pushes his final delivery a touch fuller and gets the ball to move in off the seam, but Gul presents the full face of the bat in defence
Swann comes round the wicket to Razzaq and is tapped down to long-on for one

terrible running! The pressure was building but they really didn't need this. Gul played with the turn to short fine leg, Razzaq wanted the run but Gul hesitated before setting off, the throw came in to Swann and he whipped the bails off at the non-striker's end with Gul well short
tapped to cover point, Razzaq calls him through and though Ajmal hesitates for a moment he sprints through and is safe
Ajmal is off the mark straight away, clipping through square leg
driven inside-out, hard but straight to extra cover
this time Razzaq finds the gap, driving out to deep cover
short and rising on off stump, Razzaq takes the bottom hand off the bat and fends to gully for a single
he's hit him! Bouncer from Broad, Ajmal tries to hook but the ball pings off the side of his helmet and goes to third man. He's fine though, and trying not to look rattled
beaten outside off! Back of a length and fast from Broad, Razzaq wafts and the ball shoots past the outside edge

there goes another one! Ajmal is run out, Razzaq drove a fullish ball to Morgan in the covers and set off for a single. Hesitation from both batsmen but Ajmal eventually tries to take the run, Morgan hurls in a shy right on target and he's not even in the frame. Just one more needed by England
Shoaib's not going to be getting in line with many... back of a length from Broad, Shoaib steps to leg and pokes at it as the ball bursts past the outside edge

that's it, all over now! Pakistan fold with a whimper as Shoaib backs to leg, Broad follows him and Shoaib shuts his eyes and fends... a leading edge loops into the covers and fittingly Eoin Morgan takes the catch that wins the match and seals the series for England
